channel.title: Sports News Headlines - Yahoo! News
channel.description: Get the latest sports news headlines from Yahoo! News. Find breaking sports news, including analysis and opinion on top sports stories.

item.title: Wild Oats XI, Perpetual Loyal in Hobart race duel
item.description: HOBART, Australia (AP) — Defending champion Wild Oats XI took a 10 nautical-mile lead over fellow super maxi Perpetual Loyal into the second night of the Sydney to Hobart yacht race on Friday.
item.media:text: HOBART, Australia (AP) — Defending champion Wild Oats XI took a 10 nautical-mile lead over fellow super maxi Perpetual Loyal into the second night of the Sydney to Hobart yacht race on Friday.

item.title: LeBron James wins AP Male Athlete of the Year
item.description: MIAMI (AP) — The only thing that keeps LeBron James up worrying at night is basketball, which simultaneously makes perfect sense and no sense.
item.media:text: MIAMI (AP) — The only thing that keeps LeBron James up worrying at night is basketball, which simultaneously makes perfect sense and no sense.

item.title: Packers' Rodgers back, to start Bears game
item.description: GREEN BAY, Wis. (AP) — Aaron Rodgers has been cleared to return from a left collarbone injury, just in time to start Sunday for the Packers against the Chicago Bears in a game to decide the NFC North title.
item.media:text: GREEN BAY, Wis. (AP) — Aaron Rodgers has been cleared to return from a left collarbone injury, just in time to start Sunday for the Packers against the Chicago Bears in a game to decide the NFC North title.

item.title: Blazers beat Clippers 116-112 in OT win
item.description: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) — LaMarcus Aldridge wasn't even sure he was going to play against the Clippers.
item.media:text: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) — LaMarcus Aldridge wasn't even sure he was going to play against the Clippers.

item.title: Conner leads Pitt to 30-27 win over Bowling Green
item.description: DETROIT (AP) — James Conner surpassed Tony Dorsett in the Pittsburgh record book — and that's not all.
item.media:text: DETROIT (AP) — James Conner surpassed Tony Dorsett in the Pittsburgh record book — and that's not all.

item.title: NFL players still hiding, playing with concussions
item.description: ALLEN PARK, Mich. (AP) — Detroit Lions tight end Dorin Dickerson is the latest NFL player to stay in a game with a concussion.
item.media:text: ALLEN PARK, Mich. (AP) — Detroit Lions tight end Dorin Dickerson is the latest NFL player to stay in a game with a concussion.

item.title: Aggies beat Lynch, No. 24 NIU 21-14 in Poinsettia
item.description: SAN DIEGO (AP) — Joey DeMartino starred in his hometown Poinsettia Bowl.
item.media:text: SAN DIEGO (AP) — Joey DeMartino starred in his hometown Poinsettia Bowl.

item.title: AP source: Choo passes physical with Rangers
item.description: Shin-Soo Choo passed his physical with the Texas Rangers, clearing the way for the completion of the outfielder's $130 million, seven-year deal.

item.title: Teague's clutch shot give Hawks 127-125 win in 2OT
item.description: CLEVELAND (AP) — Jeff Teague never saw his winning shot bounce five times off the rim and fall through the basket Thursday night.
item.media:text: CLEVELAND (AP) — Jeff Teague never saw his winning shot bounce five times off the rim and fall through the basket Thursday night.

item.title: NBA: Blake Griffin shouldn't have been ejected
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The NBA said Thursday that its referees made a mistake when they ejected Los Angeles forward Blake Griffin in the Clippers' 105-103 loss at Golden State on Wednesday night.
item.media:text: NEW YORK (AP) — The NBA said Thursday that its referees made a mistake when they ejected Los Angeles forward Blake Griffin in the Clippers' 105-103 loss at Golden State on Wednesday night.

item.title: Parker, Duncan powers Spurs over Mavericks
item.description: Dallas (AFP) - Tony Parker scored 23 points and Tim Duncan added 21 points and 13 rebounds to spark the San Antonio Spurs to a 116-107 NBA victory at Dallas.
item.media:text: Dallas (AFP) - Tony Parker scored 23 points and Tim Duncan added 21 points and 13 rebounds to spark the San Antonio Spurs to a 116-107 NBA victory at Dallas.

item.title: Rodgers ready to return for Green Bay showdown at Chicago
item.description: Green Bay (United States) (AFP) - Aaron Rodgers, who missed the past seven games for Green Bay with a broken collarbone, was named Thursday as the Packers' starting quarterback for Sunday's crucial NFL game at Chicago. Packers coach Mike McCarthy said Rodgers has made steady improvement in workouts over the past three weeks, including a Thursday practice, and will be set to face the Bears, against whom he suffered the injury in a November 4 home loss. Chicago leads the NFC North division at 8-7 with Green Bay next at 7-7 with one draw. The Packers are 5-3 with Rodgers guiding the offensive unit and 2-4 with one draw in his absence.
item.media:text: Green Bay (United States) (AFP) - Aaron Rodgers, who missed the past seven games for Green Bay with a broken collarbone, was named Thursday as the Packers' starting quarterback for Sunday's crucial NFL game at Chicago. Packers coach Mike McCarthy said Rodgers has made steady improvement in workouts over the past three weeks, including a Thursday practice, and will be set to face the Bears, against whom he suffered the injury in a November 4 home loss. Chicago leads the NFC North division at 8-7 with Green Bay next at 7-7 with one draw. The Packers are 5-3 with Rodgers guiding the offensive unit and 2-4 with one draw in his absence.

item.title: Lions sign US star Isles, 'rugby's fastest man'
item.description: Carlin Isles, a 24-year-old US sevens winger touted as the fastest man in rugby, was signed to a practice squad receiver contract Thursday by the NFL's Detroit Lions. The Lions, eliminated from American football playoff contention last Sunday, have been known for unusual moves in trying to land talent, bringing in a German player last year and Norwegian kicker Havard Rugland earlier this year after seeing him on a YouTube video. "I'm very happy," Isles told ESPN. "Being in an NFL locker room has been a true blessing for me.
item.media:text: Carlin Isles, a 24-year-old US sevens winger touted as the fastest man in rugby, was signed to a practice squad receiver contract Thursday by the NFL's Detroit Lions. The Lions, eliminated from American football playoff contention last Sunday, have been known for unusual moves in trying to land talent, bringing in a German player last year and Norwegian kicker Havard Rugland earlier this year after seeing him on a YouTube video. "I'm very happy," Isles told ESPN. "Being in an NFL locker room has been a true blessing for me.

item.title: Packers' Rodgers cleared to play against Bears
item.description: (Reuters) - Standout quarterback Aaron Rodgers will return from injury to start for Green Bay in Sunday's crucial National Football League game against the Chicago Bears, the Packers said on Thursday. He just wants to focus on football," Packers coach Mike McCarthy told reporters on Thursday. The winner of Sunday's game at Chicago will win the NFC North title and qualify for the playoffs. "I know they're excited about my return," Rodgers said of his team-mates.
item.media:text: (Reuters) - Standout quarterback Aaron Rodgers will return from injury to start for Green Bay in Sunday's crucial National Football League game against the Chicago Bears, the Packers said on Thursday. He just wants to focus on football," Packers coach Mike McCarthy told reporters on Thursday. The winner of Sunday's game at Chicago will win the NFC North title and qualify for the playoffs. "I know they're excited about my return," Rodgers said of his team-mates.

item.title: LeBron, Durant pace All-Star ballot leaders
item.description: Four-time NBA Most Valuable Player LeBron James and NBA scoring leader Kevin Durant are the top ballot choices in fan voting for the 2014 NBA All-Star Game announced Thursday. James, who turns 29 on Monday, has the top vote total at 854,105 after guiding the Miami Heat to the NBA title the past two seasons. Durant is second overall and leading the Western Conference at 850,728 votes. He is averaging 28.1 points a game for the Oklahoma City Thunder, who are level with Portland and Indiana for the NBA's best record at 23-5.
item.media:text: Four-time NBA Most Valuable Player LeBron James and NBA scoring leader Kevin Durant are the top ballot choices in fan voting for the 2014 NBA All-Star Game announced Thursday. James, who turns 29 on Monday, has the top vote total at 854,105 after guiding the Miami Heat to the NBA title the past two seasons. Durant is second overall and leading the Western Conference at 850,728 votes. He is averaging 28.1 points a game for the Oklahoma City Thunder, who are level with Portland and Indiana for the NBA's best record at 23-5.

item.title: Wild finish looms as teams eye final playoff spots
item.description: By Mark Lamport-Stokes (Reuters) - One of the wildest and most unpredictable regular seasons ever in the National Football League will conclude in gripping 'what next?' fashion on Sunday with 10 teams still in the hunt for the last four playoff spots. In the American Football Conference, the Denver Broncos, New England Patriots, Cincinnati Bengals, Indianapolis Colts and Kansas City Chiefs have all secured playoff berths, leaving four teams to battle it out for the final wildcard spot. However each of those four - the Miami Dolphins (8-7), Baltimore Ravens (8-7), San Diego Chargers (8-7) and Pittsburgh Steelers (7-8) - need to win on Sunday and also have other results go their way if they are to advance.
item.media:text: By Mark Lamport-Stokes (Reuters) - One of the wildest and most unpredictable regular seasons ever in the National Football League will conclude in gripping 'what next?' fashion on Sunday with 10 teams still in the hunt for the last four playoff spots. In the American Football Conference, the Denver Broncos, New England Patriots, Cincinnati Bengals, Indianapolis Colts and Kansas City Chiefs have all secured playoff berths, leaving four teams to battle it out for the final wildcard spot. However each of those four - the Miami Dolphins (8-7), Baltimore Ravens (8-7), San Diego Chargers (8-7) and Pittsburgh Steelers (7-8) - need to win on Sunday and also have other results go their way if they are to advance.

item.title: Cowboys' coach not giving up on Romo playing Sunday
item.description: (Reuters) - Dallas Cowboys coach Jason Garrett will not rule Tony Romo out of Sunday's important National Football League game with the Philadelphia Eagles even if the star quarterback does not practice on Friday. Romo, who has an injured back, did not attend practice on Thursday as the Cowboys prepared for the home contest, which will decide the NFC East title and a playoff spot. But Garrett played his cards close to his chest on whether Romo would play.
item.media:text: (Reuters) - Dallas Cowboys coach Jason Garrett will not rule Tony Romo out of Sunday's important National Football League game with the Philadelphia Eagles even if the star quarterback does not practice on Friday. Romo, who has an injured back, did not attend practice on Thursday as the Cowboys prepared for the home contest, which will decide the NFC East title and a playoff spot. But Garrett played his cards close to his chest on whether Romo would play.

Miami (8-7) Still alive 7. Baltimore (8-7) 8. San Diego (8-7) 9. Pittsburgh(7-8) Eliminated 10. New York Jets (7-8) 11. Tennessee (6-9) 12. Buffalo(6-9) 13. Oakland (4-11) 14. Jacksonville (4-11) 15. Cleveland (4-11) 16. Houston (2-13) - - NATIONAL FOOTBALL CONFERENCE 1. x Seattle (12-3) 2. ...

item.title: James, Wade put on a show in Heat's win over Lakers
item.description: LeBron James and Dwyane Wade put on a show to help Miami hold off the depleted but dogged Los Angeles Lakers for a 101-95 Christmas Day NBA victory. The two-time defending champion Heat were heavy favorites in the holiday matchup against a Lakers team beset by injuries -- including the broken bone in superstar Kobe Bryant's left knee. The Lakers, losers of their last two contests, managed to stick with the Heat for much of the game, which was tied 83-83 with 8:25 remaining. But the Heat authored a 9-0 scoring run to take control for good.
item.media:text: LeBron James and Dwyane Wade put on a show to help Miami hold off the depleted but dogged Los Angeles Lakers for a 101-95 Christmas Day NBA victory. The two-time defending champion Heat were heavy favorites in the holiday matchup against a Lakers team beset by injuries -- including the broken bone in superstar Kobe Bryant's left knee. The Lakers, losers of their last two contests, managed to stick with the Heat for much of the game, which was tied 83-83 with 8:25 remaining. But the Heat authored a 9-0 scoring run to take control for good.

item.title: Japan pitcher Tanaka freed up to join MLB
item.description: The club of star Japanese pitcher Masahiro Tanaka has approved his move to the US major leagues, at a likely bargain price for such a high-profile trans-Pacific deal because of a new "posting" system. The Rakuten Eagles, powered by Tanaka to their first-ever "Japan Series" national title this year, spent about a week after the launch of the new system before announcing on Wednesday they would release the 25-year-old right hander. The new rules put a $20 million cap on the money a Japanese team can earn from posting a player for a transfer to a major league club. And the club, which owns a precious player, feels it is unequal," Rakuten president Yozo Tachibana told a news conference, without disclosing the release fee the club wants.
item.media:text: The club of star Japanese pitcher Masahiro Tanaka has approved his move to the US major leagues, at a likely bargain price for such a high-profile trans-Pacific deal because of a new "posting" system. The Rakuten Eagles, powered by Tanaka to their first-ever "Japan Series" national title this year, spent about a week after the launch of the new system before announcing on Wednesday they would release the 25-year-old right hander. The new rules put a $20 million cap on the money a Japanese team can earn from posting a player for a transfer to a major league club. And the club, which owns a precious player, feels it is unequal," Rakuten president Yozo Tachibana told a news conference, without disclosing the release fee the club wants.

item.title: Bartoli and Parkes L'Equipe's French sportspeople of year
item.description: Wimbledon women's singles champion Marion Bartoli and NBA star Tony Parker were named female and male sports person of the year by French sports newspaper L'Equipe on Wednesday. Bartoli, 29, topped the women's section with 886 points following her stunning success at Wimbledon beating German Sabine Lisicki, her first - and only - Grand Slam crown at the 47th attempt, a record in the women's game for those who have finally captured such a lofty honour. Two skiers downhill world champion Marion Rolland (522pts) and giant slalom world champion Tessa Worley (520pts) finished second and third but not much consolation given both have been ruled out of February's Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia, because of injury. Parker, who plays guard for the San Antonio Spurs, beat Judoka legend Olympic and six-time world champion Teddy Riner (555 pts), who won the award last year.
item.media:text: Wimbledon women's singles champion Marion Bartoli and NBA star Tony Parker were named female and male sports person of the year by French sports newspaper L'Equipe on Wednesday. Bartoli, 29, topped the women's section with 886 points following her stunning success at Wimbledon beating German Sabine Lisicki, her first - and only - Grand Slam crown at the 47th attempt, a record in the women's game for those who have finally captured such a lofty honour. Two skiers downhill world champion Marion Rolland (522pts) and giant slalom world champion Tessa Worley (520pts) finished second and third but not much consolation given both have been ruled out of February's Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia, because of injury. Parker, who plays guard for the San Antonio Spurs, beat Judoka legend Olympic and six-time world champion Teddy Riner (555 pts), who won the award last year.

item.title: Rodgers promises Thursday decision for Packers
item.description: (Reuters) - Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers says he will know by Thursday whether he will be cleared medically to play in Sunday's pivotal regular-season finale against the Chicago Bears. Rodgers on Tuesday apologized to his team's fans for keeping them in suspense in recent weeks over whether he had sufficiently recovered to make a competitive comeback. "We are going through the process of evaluation," Rodgers said on Milwaukee's WAUK-AM 540. What a better way to do that than against the Chicago Bears?" The return of Rodgers, the Super Bowl's most valuable player in 2011, would give the Packers (7-7-1) a massive boost as they bid to clinch their third consecutive NFC North title.
item.media:text: (Reuters) - Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers says he will know by Thursday whether he will be cleared medically to play in Sunday's pivotal regular-season finale against the Chicago Bears. Rodgers on Tuesday apologized to his team's fans for keeping them in suspense in recent weeks over whether he had sufficiently recovered to make a competitive comeback. "We are going through the process of evaluation," Rodgers said on Milwaukee's WAUK-AM 540. What a better way to do that than against the Chicago Bears?" The return of Rodgers, the Super Bowl's most valuable player in 2011, would give the Packers (7-7-1) a massive boost as they bid to clinch their third consecutive NFC North title.

item.title: NFL Cowboys owner Jones still hoping Romo plays
item.description: Dallas owner Jerry Jones still hopes Tony Romo will lead the Cowboys in a do-or-die NFL clash with Philadelphia, with the quarterback reportedly receiving an epidural injection to combat back pain. The Cowboys host the Eagles in the final game of the regular season on Sunday with the winners claiming the NFC East division title and an NFL playoff berth. In his weekly radio show on Tuesday, Jones said backup quarterback Kyle Orton -- who hasn't started a game since 2011 -- would be ready to play if necessary, but that Romo would play if doctors agree. ESPN.com reported that the Cowboys signal-caller has a herniated disk in his lower back and received an epidural injection to relieve pain and inflammation.
item.media:text: Dallas owner Jerry Jones still hopes Tony Romo will lead the Cowboys in a do-or-die NFL clash with Philadelphia, with the quarterback reportedly receiving an epidural injection to combat back pain. The Cowboys host the Eagles in the final game of the regular season on Sunday with the winners claiming the NFC East division title and an NFL playoff berth. In his weekly radio show on Tuesday, Jones said backup quarterback Kyle Orton -- who hasn't started a game since 2011 -- would be ready to play if necessary, but that Romo would play if doctors agree. ESPN.com reported that the Cowboys signal-caller has a herniated disk in his lower back and received an epidural injection to relieve pain and inflammation.

item.title: Waiting game continues for Cowboys over injured Romo
item.description: (Reuters) - The Dallas Cowboys say that Tony Romo has not been ruled out of Sunday's crucial regular season finale against the Philadelphia Eagles, though one major media outlet claimed that the quarterback's season was done and dusted. ESPN reported on Tuesday that Romo was diagnosed with a herniated disc in his back and had an epidural injection after apparently aggravating a back injury during Sunday's 24-23 win against the Washington Redskins. Citing "sources close to the quarterback", ESPN said that Romo was unlikely to return to competition in such a short time and that he had been advised to have surgery.
item.media:text: (Reuters) - The Dallas Cowboys say that Tony Romo has not been ruled out of Sunday's crucial regular season finale against the Philadelphia Eagles, though one major media outlet claimed that the quarterback's season was done and dusted. ESPN reported on Tuesday that Romo was diagnosed with a herniated disc in his back and had an epidural injection after apparently aggravating a back injury during Sunday's 24-23 win against the Washington Redskins. Citing "sources close to the quarterback", ESPN said that Romo was unlikely to return to competition in such a short time and that he had been advised to have surgery.

item.title: Nets' Pierce fined $15,000 for flagrant foul on Hill
item.description: (Reuters) - Brooklyn Nets forward Paul Pierce has been fined $15,000 by the National Basketball Association (NBA) for committing a flagrant foul on opposing point guard George Hill during Monday's game against the Indiana Pacers. The incident occurred during the third quarter of Brooklyn's 103-86 loss to Indiana, when Pierce made a "clothesline" tackle on Hill as the Pacers player was going for a lay-up.
item.media:text: (Reuters) - Brooklyn Nets forward Paul Pierce has been fined $15,000 by the National Basketball Association (NBA) for committing a flagrant foul on opposing point guard George Hill during Monday's game against the Indiana Pacers. The incident occurred during the third quarter of Brooklyn's 103-86 loss to Indiana, when Pierce made a "clothesline" tackle on Hill as the Pacers player was going for a lay-up.

item.title: Little Christmas cheer for NBA's lagging teams
item.description: Lakers coach Mike D'Antoni was among a trio of NBA coaches feeling decidedly un-festive this week as Christmas approached with their teams mired in December difficulties. D'Antoni, whose team has struggled with injuries to superstar Kobe Bryant and veteran point guard Steve Nash among others, didn't have any sympathy to spare for Lakers fans after the team's second straight blowout road defeat on Monday night, a 117-90 loss at Phoenix. The Lakers were coming off a 102-83 loss at Golden State on Saturday.
item.media:text: Lakers coach Mike D'Antoni was among a trio of NBA coaches feeling decidedly un-festive this week as Christmas approached with their teams mired in December difficulties. D'Antoni, whose team has struggled with injuries to superstar Kobe Bryant and veteran point guard Steve Nash among others, didn't have any sympathy to spare for Lakers fans after the team's second straight blowout road defeat on Monday night, a 117-90 loss at Phoenix. The Lakers were coming off a 102-83 loss at Golden State on Saturday.

item.title: Paddy Power pulls support for Rodman's North Korean trips
item.description: Irish bookmaker Paddy Power has withdrawn its sponsorship of retired U.S. basketball player Dennis Rodman's visits to North Korea, saying it was a result of general condemnation of Pyongyang. Rodman returned on Monday from a four-day trip to isolated North Korea that was arranged by Paddy Power and followed the rare public purge of leader Kim Jong Un's powerful uncle Jang Song Thaek, who was executed this month. "It was really a reaction to the worldwide focus and total condemnation of the North Korean regime over recent events," the betting firm, which is renowned for its daring marketing, said in a statement. "We don't want to be associated with that." North Korea's economy, once larger than South Korea's, is now a fortieth the size of its neighbor.
item.media:text: Irish bookmaker Paddy Power has withdrawn its sponsorship of retired U.S. basketball player Dennis Rodman's visits to North Korea, saying it was a result of general condemnation of Pyongyang. Rodman returned on Monday from a four-day trip to isolated North Korea that was arranged by Paddy Power and followed the rare public purge of leader Kim Jong Un's powerful uncle Jang Song Thaek, who was executed this month. "It was really a reaction to the worldwide focus and total condemnation of the North Korean regime over recent events," the betting firm, which is renowned for its daring marketing, said in a statement. "We don't want to be associated with that." North Korea's economy, once larger than South Korea's, is now a fortieth the size of its neighbor.

item.title: Judge in murder case of ex-NFL star considers gag order
item.description: By Daniel Lovering FALL RIVER, Massachusetts (Reuters) - A Massachusetts judge said on Monday she would consider a request by lawyers defending former National Football League star Aaron Hernandez that she issue a gag order preventing leaks about the high-profile murder case. Judge Susan Garsh asked attorneys to submit proposed media guidelines after an attorney for Hernandez complained about "prejudicial" reports that had surfaced in the press quoting unnamed law enforcement officials. Hernandez, 24, was charged in the fatal shooting of his friend, Odin Lloyd, in an industrial area near his home in North Attleborough, Massachusetts.
item.media:text: By Daniel Lovering FALL RIVER, Massachusetts (Reuters) - A Massachusetts judge said on Monday she would consider a request by lawyers defending former National Football League star Aaron Hernandez that she issue a gag order preventing leaks about the high-profile murder case. Judge Susan Garsh asked attorneys to submit proposed media guidelines after an attorney for Hernandez complained about "prejudicial" reports that had surfaced in the press quoting unnamed law enforcement officials. Hernandez, 24, was charged in the fatal shooting of his friend, Odin Lloyd, in an industrial area near his home in North Attleborough, Massachusetts.

item.title: 49ers claim playoff spot in dramatic fashion
item.description: (Reuters) - A dramatic, fourth-quarter interception return clinched a playoff spot for the San Francisco 49ers as they edged the Atlanta Falcons 34-24 on Monday to celebrate their final regular season game at Candlestick Park. With the 49ers leading just 27-24 and about two minutes left, Atlanta drove down to San Francisco's 10 yard-line before quarterback Matt Ryan saw his pass intercepted by Navorro Bowman, who took it 89 yards for the clinching score. "A lot of history in this stadium, and for this to be the last game we could not leave with the (loss)." The wild finish put San Francisco (11-4) back in the playoffs after reaching the Super Bowl last season.
item.media:text: (Reuters) - A dramatic, fourth-quarter interception return clinched a playoff spot for the San Francisco 49ers as they edged the Atlanta Falcons 34-24 on Monday to celebrate their final regular season game at Candlestick Park. With the 49ers leading just 27-24 and about two minutes left, Atlanta drove down to San Francisco's 10 yard-line before quarterback Matt Ryan saw his pass intercepted by Navorro Bowman, who took it 89 yards for the clinching score. "A lot of history in this stadium, and for this to be the last game we could not leave with the (loss)." The wild finish put San Francisco (11-4) back in the playoffs after reaching the Super Bowl last season.

item.title: 49ers clinch playoff spot in Candlestick Park farewell
item.description: NaVorro Bowman's interception return for a touchdown sealed San Francisco's 34-24 win over Atlanta, clinching an NFL playoff spot for the 49ers in their farewell to Candlestick Park. The 49ers almost wasted a chance to punch their post-season ticket, and the underdog Falcons almost spoiled what was supposed to be a celebratory send-off to Candlestick in the last regular-season game to be held there.
item.media:text: NaVorro Bowman's interception return for a touchdown sealed San Francisco's 34-24 win over Atlanta, clinching an NFL playoff spot for the 49ers in their farewell to Candlestick Park. The 49ers almost wasted a chance to punch their post-season ticket, and the underdog Falcons almost spoiled what was supposed to be a celebratory send-off to Candlestick in the last regular-season game to be held there.

item.title: James scores 38 as Heat hold off Hawks in overtime
item.description: LeBron James scored 38 points with eight rebounds and six assists to lead the Miami Heat to a 121-110 victory over Atlanta in an NBA overtime thriller. Michael Beasley added two crucial free throws with less than 10 seconds to play, giving the Heat a lead they wouldn't relinquish. Miami trailed 119-116 when Chris Anderson's layup with 1:08 left in the extra period narrowed the gap to 119-118.
item.media:text: LeBron James scored 38 points with eight rebounds and six assists to lead the Miami Heat to a 121-110 victory over Atlanta in an NBA overtime thriller. Michael Beasley added two crucial free throws with less than 10 seconds to play, giving the Heat a lead they wouldn't relinquish. Miami trailed 119-116 when Chris Anderson's layup with 1:08 left in the extra period narrowed the gap to 119-118.

item.title: Knicks edge Magic, lose Anthony to sprained ankle
item.description: The New York Knicks lost Carmelo Anthony to a sprained ankle, but turned back a furious Orlando rally to post a 103-98 NBA victory over the Magic. Knicks forward Anthony had 19 points when he departed the contest midway through the third quarter after appearing to twist his left ankle on Orlando center Nikola Vucevic's foot while trying to grab an offensive rebound. His exit signalled the start of a Magic surge as they erased a 24-point halftime deficit and narrowed the gap to 83-84 with 8:28 left to play. "All teams make runs and they made a hell of a run," Knicks head coach Mike Woodson said of the Magic's surge.
item.media:text: The New York Knicks lost Carmelo Anthony to a sprained ankle, but turned back a furious Orlando rally to post a 103-98 NBA victory over the Magic. Knicks forward Anthony had 19 points when he departed the contest midway through the third quarter after appearing to twist his left ankle on Orlando center Nikola Vucevic's foot while trying to grab an offensive rebound. His exit signalled the start of a Magic surge as they erased a 24-point halftime deficit and narrowed the gap to 83-84 with 8:28 left to play. "All teams make runs and they made a hell of a run," Knicks head coach Mike Woodson said of the Magic's surge.

item.title: Clippers' Barnes fined $25,000
item.description: Los Angeles Clippers forward Matt Barnes was fined $25,000 by the NBA on Monday for failing to leave the court promptly when he was ejected from a game against Minnesota. Barnes was assessed a flagrant foul 2 for a hard foul on a driving Kevin Love and was tossed from the contest with 56.8 left in the third quarter. League officials downgraded the foul to a less serious flagrant 1 after reviewing the video in the wake of the Clippers' 120-116 overtime victory, but his failure to leave the court in a "timely manner" still drew the fine. In fact, Barnes was restrained by teammates Stephen Jackson and Willie Green as he appeared ready to go after referee Marc Davis.
item.media:text: Los Angeles Clippers forward Matt Barnes was fined $25,000 by the NBA on Monday for failing to leave the court promptly when he was ejected from a game against Minnesota. Barnes was assessed a flagrant foul 2 for a hard foul on a driving Kevin Love and was tossed from the contest with 56.8 left in the third quarter. League officials downgraded the foul to a less serious flagrant 1 after reviewing the video in the wake of the Clippers' 120-116 overtime victory, but his failure to leave the court in a "timely manner" still drew the fine. In fact, Barnes was restrained by teammates Stephen Jackson and Willie Green as he appeared ready to go after referee Marc Davis.

item.title: Lions' fading season no failure, says coach Schwartz
item.description: (Reuters) - Detroit Lions coach Jim Schwartz is reluctant to describe his team's fading season as one of "failure", saying he was proud of the way his players kept battling as their fortunes dipped. The Lions go into Sunday's regular season finale against the Vikings in Minnesota with a 7-8 record, having made a promising 6-3 start to their campaign before their momentum stalled. "As a head coach standing up here, I have a hard time going down into our locker room with our players and calling them and calling us a failure," Schwartz told reporters on Monday. When I hear the word failure, I hear abject failure.
item.media:text: (Reuters) - Detroit Lions coach Jim Schwartz is reluctant to describe his team's fading season as one of "failure", saying he was proud of the way his players kept battling as their fortunes dipped. The Lions go into Sunday's regular season finale against the Vikings in Minnesota with a 7-8 record, having made a promising 6-3 start to their campaign before their momentum stalled. "As a head coach standing up here, I have a hard time going down into our locker room with our players and calling them and calling us a failure," Schwartz told reporters on Monday. When I hear the word failure, I hear abject failure.

item.title: Romo 'day-to-day' for Eagles game due to back injury
item.description: (Reuters) - Dallas Cowboys quarterback Tony Romo has been assessed as "day-to-day" ahead of Sunday's crucial regular season finale against the Philadelphia Eagles due to a lingering back injury, the NFL team said on Monday. The NFL Network and ESPN, meanwhile, were reporting that Romo had a herniated disc that could require surgery. Romo, 33, aggravated his back injury during Sunday's 24-23 win against the Washington Redskins but continued to play on and found DeMarco Murray with a decisive 10-yard touchdown strike with just 68 seconds remaining. "We haven't made that determination at all at this point," Cowboys head coach Jason Garrett said during a news conference when asked if Romo could be ruled out for the rest of the season.
item.media:text: (Reuters) - Dallas Cowboys quarterback Tony Romo has been assessed as "day-to-day" ahead of Sunday's crucial regular season finale against the Philadelphia Eagles due to a lingering back injury, the NFL team said on Monday. The NFL Network and ESPN, meanwhile, were reporting that Romo had a herniated disc that could require surgery. Romo, 33, aggravated his back injury during Sunday's 24-23 win against the Washington Redskins but continued to play on and found DeMarco Murray with a decisive 10-yard touchdown strike with just 68 seconds remaining. "We haven't made that determination at all at this point," Cowboys head coach Jason Garrett said during a news conference when asked if Romo could be ruled out for the rest of the season.

item.title: Romo rumors swirl, Dallas coach says QB 'day-to-day'
item.description: Tony Romo, whose late touchdown pass on Sunday kept the Dallas Cowboys' NFL playoff hopes alive, might not be available to try to take them the rest of the way. NFL.com and ESPN.com reported Monday that a back injury would bar Romo from next Sunday's do-or-die showdown with the Philadelphia Eagles, although Cowboys head coach Jason Garrett said the team had not yet determined if their star quarterback would be able to play. Asked to comment on the reports that Romo wouldn't be available, Garrett said: "We'll evaluate Tony's injury day by day." Garrett said that Romo was receiving treatment, and that backup Kyle Orton would be ready to play if called on.

NFL.com and ESPN.com reported Monday that a back injury would bar Romo from next Sunday's do-or-die showdown with the Philadelphia Eagles, although Cowboys head coach Jason Garrett said the team had not yet determined if their star quarterback would be able to play. Asked to comment on the reports that Romo wouldn't be available, Garrett said: "We'll evaluate Tony's injury day by day." Garrett said that Romo was receiving treatment, and that backup Kyle Orton would be ready to play if called on.

item.title: Ex-NFL star Aaron Hernandez back in court on murder charges
item.description: By Daniel Lovering BOSTON (Reuters) - Former National Football League star Aaron Hernandez, who was accused of killing a semi-professional football player in June, is due back in a Massachusetts court on Monday afternoon for a hearing in the case. The former New England Patriots tight end was charged in the fatal shooting of his friend, Odin Lloyd, in an industrial area near his home in North Attleborough, Massachusetts. Hernandez, 24, a star player with a $41 million contract when he was arrested, pleaded not guilty to murder and weapons-related charges and is being held in Bristol County Jail while awaiting trial. Hernandez is expected to appear at Fall River Superior Court in Fall River, Massachusetts, for a pretrial conference and discovery status hearing, a court official said.
item.media:text: By Daniel Lovering BOSTON (Reuters) - Former National Football League star Aaron Hernandez, who was accused of killing a semi-professional football player in June, is due back in a Massachusetts court on Monday afternoon for a hearing in the case. The former New England Patriots tight end was charged in the fatal shooting of his friend, Odin Lloyd, in an industrial area near his home in North Attleborough, Massachusetts. Hernandez, 24, a star player with a $41 million contract when he was arrested, pleaded not guilty to murder and weapons-related charges and is being held in Bristol County Jail while awaiting trial. Hernandez is expected to appear at Fall River Superior Court in Fall River, Massachusetts, for a pretrial conference and discovery status hearing, a court official said.

item.title: Panthers' Smith "highly doubtful" for game against Falcons
item.description: (Reuters) - Carolina Panthers coach Ron Rivera on Monday described wide receiver Steve Smith as "highly doubtful" to play in Sunday's pivotal regular-season finale against the Atlanta Falcons because of a sprained left knee. The (11-4) Panthers earned a playoff spot by beating the (10-5) New Orleans Saints 17-13 on Sunday and would clinch the NFC South division title and a coveted first-round bye with victory over the Falcons, who are 4-10 going into their Monday night game against San Francisco. Five-time Pro Bowler Smith, who injured his knee during the first quarter against the Saints, had a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) exam on Monday which revealed a sprained posterior cruciate ligament. It was good news considering the alternative." Rivera said that Ted Ginn Jr. would probably take over in the starting role from Smith, who has had 64 catches for 745 yards with four touchdowns this season.

Five-time Pro Bowler Smith, who injured his knee during the first quarter against the Saints, had a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) exam on Monday which revealed a sprained posterior cruciate ligament. It was good news considering the alternative." Rivera said that Ted Ginn Jr. would probably take over in the starting role from Smith, who has had 64 catches for 745 yards with four touchdowns this season.

item.title: Broncos linebacker Miller out with torn ACL
item.description: (Reuters) - The playoff-bound Denver Broncos will mount their Super Bowl campaign without pass-rushing linebacker Von Miller, who suffered a torn knee ligament in Sunday's win over the Houston Texans, the NFL's website said on Monday. An MRI test on Monday revealed the extent of the injury to Miller, who was injured in the first quarter of Denver's 37-13 victory in Houston, nfl.com reported. ...

An MRI test on Monday revealed the extent of the injury to Miller, who was injured in the first quarter of Denver's 37-13 victory in Houston, nfl.com reported. ...

item.title: Bears' Melton arrested in Texas for suspected assault
item.description: Chicago Bears defensive lineman Henry Melton was arrested early on Sunday on suspicion of public intoxication and for assaulting the manager of a suburban sports bar in Dallas, Texas. Melton, 27, was asked to leave the restaurant in the suburb of Grapevine, but refused to go. He then became violent, the Grapevine Police Department said in a statement on Monday. Police said it took four security guards to restrain the 295-pound (134 kg) National Football League player until police arrived.
